alert.note: Alert for Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 8:33AM MST until January 06 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Periods of heavy snow. Total 48 hour snow accumulations of 15 to 25 inches with isolated higher totals to 35 inches on the highest peaks. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains and Salt River and Wyoming Ranges. * WHEN...Until 11 PM Thursday. The snow will become lighter and decrease in coverage by late morning. However heavier snow will again break out after midnight tonight, and last through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel over passes will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow is likely to significantly reduce visibility down to a tenth of a mile at times. People recreating in the backcountry could become disoriented. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Please monitor JHAVALANCHE.ORG for the avalanche risk across western Wyoming.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, water, and a charger for your cell phone in case of an emergency. Call 5 1 1, to get the latest road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains
